p:
We used climate data from ClimateNA v5.40
41 ( http://tinyurl.com/ClimateNA), which are based on CRU TS3.22
42 gridded historical monthly data, downscaled and interpolated to adjust the mean and variance of the original CRU time series to elevation- and location-specific values. Future climate projections were taken from 15 Atmosphere-Ocean General Circulation Models of the CMIP5 multimodel dataset, i.e., the IPCC Assessment Report 5 (2013). We focus on climate normals for the 2010–2039, 2040–2069, and 2070–2099 periods under emission scenario RCP8.5, an extra 8.5 W m −2 of energy retained by the atmosphere compared to the pre-industrial baseline.
